title: 107_hr1573
content: The "Social Security Protection and Tax Relief Act of 2001" imposes social security taxes on certain unearned income to address the disparity between taxes on earned and unearned income. This Act aims to ensure fairness in the tax system by including unearned income such as dividends, interest, rent income, and capital gains in the social security tax calculation. "Part VIII introduces a social security tax on specific unearned income, aiming to address tax disparities and ensure fairness in the tax system." In addition to other taxes, individuals are subject to a 12 percent tax on their social security taxable income each year. Social security taxable income is defined as adjusted gross income minus the standard deduction and deduction for personal exemptions. The tax imposed by this section does not count towards determining the amount of any credit allowable under this chapter. Exempt income includes pensions, annuities, social security benefits, and earned income. The tax imposed by this section does not count towards determining the amount of any credit allowable under this chapter or the minimum tax imposed by section 55. The amendments made by this section apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2001. Funds equivalent to the tax imposed by section 59B are appropriated to payor funds, with transfers made from the general fund of the Treasury based on estimates by the Secretary of the Treasury. The Treasury makes quarterly payments to payor funds for social security benefits based on estimates by the Secretary of the Treasury. Adjustments are made for any discrepancies between estimated and actual revenue. Definitions include "payor fund" as any fund for social security benefits and "social security benefits" as defined in the Internal Revenue Code. SEC. 4. CHANGE IN RATES OF SOCIAL SECURITY TAXES. Decrease in OASDI tax rates for employees, employers, and self-employment income from 6.2% to 4.95% starting in 2002. From December 31, 1989 to January 1, 2002, the rate was 12.4, and from December 31, 2001 onwards, it decreased to 9.9.
